current.description:
Build the real-time telemetry ingestion pipeline.

What to build:
- WebSocket server at ws://localhost:8080/telemetry
- Parse incoming binary telemetry frames (header + payload)
- Frame format: [sync_byte(1)][msg_id(2)][length(2)][payload(N)][crc(2)]
- Decode attitude quaternions, GPS coordinates, power levels

Implementation:
- Use ws library for WebSocket server
- Create TelemetryDecoder class in lib/telemetry/decoder.ts
- Ring buffer for last 1000 frames
- Emit parsed events via EventEmitter pattern

Edge cases:
- Handle partial frames across WebSocket messages
- CRC validation with retry on failure
- Graceful degradation on malformed packets
acceptance: WebSocket server accepts connections on port 8080
Binary frames decoded correctly with CRC validation
Ring buffer stores last 1000 telemetry frames
Unit tests cover normal + malformed frame scenarios

completed.description: Set up Next.js 14 project with TypeScript, Tailwind, and Prisma ORM. Configure ESLint and Vitest.
Create Prisma models for orbital elements, trajectory waypoints, maneuver nodes, and celestial body ephemeris data.
Implement Keplerian orbit propagator with J2 perturbation corrections. Lambert solver for transfer orbit computation.

completed.task: Create REST API for mission planning
completed.description: Build API routes for CRUD operations on missions, waypoints, and maneuver sequences. Include validation middleware.

backlog.description:
Create a Three.js-based React component that renders orbital trajectories, celestial bodies, and spacecraft position in real-time.

Use @react-three/fiber for React integration. Render Earth with texture mapping, orbital path as a spline curve, and spacecraft as a simple mesh with orientation gizmo.
acceptance: 3D scene renders Earth with orbital trajectory
Spacecraft position updates in real-time from telemetry
Camera controls allow orbit, pan, zoom

backlog.description: Calculate visibility windows between spacecraft and ground stations using SGP4 propagation. Output AOS/LOS times and max elevation for each pass.
acceptance: Predicts passes for configured ground stations
Outputs AOS, LOS, max elevation for each pass
Results match STK reference within 30 seconds

backlog.description: Implement JWT-based auth with mission commander, engineer, and observer roles. Protect API routes with middleware. Use Argon2 for password hashing.
Create a Gantt-style timeline showing mission phases, maneuver windows, ground station passes, and eclipse periods. Interactive zoom and pan.
acceptance: Timeline renders mission phases as blocks
Zoom/pan with mouse and touch gestures

discovered.task: Handle leap seconds in time conversion
discovered.description: The trajectory engine assumes continuous time but UTC has leap seconds. Need to implement TAI-UTC conversion table for precision timing.

discovered.task: Add telemetry data export to CSV
discovered.description: Users need to export telemetry history for offline analysis. Implement CSV export with configurable column selection and time range.

notes: Using J2000 epoch as reference frame for all orbital calculations
Telemetry format based on CCSDS packet standard (simplified)
Target: sub-100ms latency for real-time telemetry display
